---
title: "About"
---

This is a brand colors example:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.1     ✔ stringr   1.5.2

✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors
```

:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library(brand.yml)
library(quarto)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```

Attaching package: 'quarto'

The following objects are masked from 'package:brand.yml':

    theme_brand_flextable, theme_brand_ggplot2, theme_brand_gt,
    theme_brand_plotly, theme_brand_thematic
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
brand <- read_brand_yml("_brand.yml")
brand_theme <- theme_brand_ggplot2("_brand.yml")

ggplot(mpg, aes(x = displ, y = hwy, color = drv)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm") +
  scale_color_manual(
    values = c(
      brand$color$palette$red,
      brand$color$palette$teal,
      brand$color$palette$orange
    )
  ) +
  labs(title = "A plot with brand colors") +
  brand_theme
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'
```
